sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Deutsch Br. = OJ 10/3, [23], January 30, 1921, with two enclosures (presumably the contract – see February 9 below), not filed with the letter. Vertrag: 8%, 3 Exemplare, Auszahlung der Hälfte.
Wieder ins Mietamt, ohne Erfolg.
Zur Hausfrau: beruft sich darauf, niemand kündigen zu dürfen.
Um 11h Lie-Liechen mit Frau Pairamall zu Frau Rohn; gegenstandslos, Frau R. bleibt in ihrer Wohnung.
op. 109 zuende korrigiert.
Lie-Liechen bessert bis 9h abends den Winterrock aus; fast fertig.

An Roth (Br.): drücke Freude über die Bändchen aus, tadle Verwechslung von Choral u. C.f., die falsche Anwendung des Wortes linear, offenbar nach Kurt; über Schmid-Büchlein Herman Roth, Heinrich Kaspar Schmid, Zeitgenössische Komponisten 6 (Munich: Drei Masken Verlag, 1921). später.
From Deutsch letter. Contract: 8%, three copies, payment of half.
Again to the Rental Authority, without success.
To the landlady: she invokes the fact that she is not allowed to evict anyone.
At 11:00 Lie-Liechen with Mrs. Pairamall to Mrs. Rohn; irrelevant, Mrs. Rohn is staying in her apartment.
Proofs of Op. 109 corrected to the end.
By 9:00 Lie-Liechen mends the winter coat; almost finished.
To Roth (letter): expressing joy about the volumes, criticizing the mix-up of chorale and c.f., the wrong use of the word linear, obviously taken from Kurt; about the little Schmid book later.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Literatur zur V. "Literatur," appearing in "Beethoven V. Sinfonie (Fortsetzung)," in: Tonwille, Heft 5 (1922), 15–31; Eng. transl., vol. I, pp. 185–201.
Caféhaus.

Lie-Liechen vollendet
den Winterrock, macht Hosenträger, rasiert mich noch des abends u. macht Brotteig.
An Wilhelm (K.): wie es geht – eventuell Messingbett besorgen.
"Secondary Literature" section to the "Fifth Symphony."
Coffee-house.

Lie-Liechen finishes off
the winter coat, makes pair of suspenders, during the evening shaves me and makes bread dough.
To Wilhelm (postcard): how is he – might possibly get hold of a brass bed.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Breisach (expr. K.): kündigt sich für Samstag ½10h an.
Von U. E.: Cf. OC 52/246, February 4, 1921. Korrekturen op. 110 u. Schubert "Franz Schubert: 'Ihr Bild' (Heine)," in: Tonwille, Heft 1 (1921), 46–49; Eng. transl. I, pp. 41–43. zum 1. Heft.
Zahle die Wasserleitungsreparatur anstelle der Hausfrau.
Lie-Liechen macht viele Wege, auch zur U.-E.
Frl. Elias bringt 65 dkg Butter.

Furtwängler-Konzert: Beethoven VII. Beethoven, Symphony No. 7 in A major, Op. 92. gut, besonders der letzte Satz; Berlioz: Carneval; Berlioz, "Carnaval romain" Overture, Op. 9. Strauß: Bürger u. Edelmann: Richard Strauss, incidental music to Der Bürger als Edelmann (Le bourgeois gentilhomme), Op. 60. höchst gekünstelt, unappetitliche Melodie-Technik, nach Straussens Vorstellung mozartisch; vor dem Konzert F. gesprochen, Herr u. Frau Buxbaum u. Fr. Hauser.
From Breisach (express postcard): announcing his coming on Saturday at 9:30.
From UE: proofs for Op. 110 and Schubert for the first issue.
Instead of the landlady of the house I have to pay the water pipe repair.
Lie-Liechen has many errands to run, also to UE.
Miss Elias brings 65 decagrams of butter.

Furtwängler concert: Beethoven, Seventh Symphony good, particularly the last movement; Berlioz: Carneval; Strauss: Der Bürger als Edelmann: highly artificial, unappetizing melodic technique, according to Strauss's own conception Mozartian; before the concert spoke to Furtwängler, Mr. and Mrs. Buxbaum and Mrs. Hauser.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von U. E. (K.): = OC 52/245, February 2, 1921. nennt Drucktypen u. erkundigt sich nach der Wahl.
¾12h ein Herr Brand, der über Empfehlung eines Herrn Holstein mich zu sprechen wünscht; bestelle ihn für Dienstag 5h.
Lie-Liechen macht viele Wege: zur U. E., ins Archiv, zum Kohlenhändler, ins Wohnungsamt: Bescheid: wir werden jeden Montag ausrufen.
From UE (postcard): specifying the typefaces and inquiring about the choice to be made.
11:45 a Mr. Brand, who wishes to speak to me via the recommendation of a Mr. Holstein; I arrange for him to come on Tuesday at 5:00.
Lie-Liechen has many things to do out and about: to UE, to the Archive, to the coal merchant, to the housing office: notified that our search will be published each Monday.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: ¾10h Breisach; erzahlt von Bamberg, von den Verhältnissen an der Wiener Oper, von der Tanzlust Furtwänglers, verspricht wiederzukommen.
Frl. Elias Butter bezahlt: 192 Kronen.
Caféhaus; zu Dr. Fischmann: Bureau geschlossen.
Von Hupka (K.): aus Berlin: Dr. Fleischmann habe in der Zeitschrift für Musik sehr abfällig geschrieben.
Von Frl. Furtscheller (Br.): Absage.
9:45 Breisach; telling us about Bamberg, about the conditions at the Vienna Opera about Furtwängler's desire to dance, promises to come again.
Have paid Miss Elias the butter: 192 Kronen.
Coffee-house; to Dr. Fischmann: his office is closed.
From Hupka (postcard): from Berlin: Dr. Fleischmann has written a very disparaging criticism in the Zeitschrift für Musik.
From Miss Furtscheller (letter): cancellation.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen etwas leidend: Obstirpation; 11h zu Frühmann, kommt erst um ½2h, dann Apotheke.
Bei Jetty.
An Fl. (K.): = OJ 8/4, [2], February 6, 1921. etwas über die Ausgaben u. Störungen.

An Vrieslander
(K.): von Cotta noch keine Antwort.
An Hertzka (expr.): Vermischtes "Vermischtes," in: Tonwille, Heft 1 (1921), 50–55; Eng. trans., I, p. 44–48. nicht in Kolumnen.
Lie-Liechen suffering somewhat: constipation; at 11:00 to Frühmann, who will not be arriving until 1:30, then to the pharmacist.
At Jetty's.
To Floriz (postcard): something about the expenditure and various troubles.

To Vrieslander
(postcard): still no answer from Cotta.
To Hertzka (express.): "Miscellanea" should not be in columns.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Aus Berlin (eing.) Bilder vom Andante.
Von Julian (Br.): Geschichte der Anstellung.
8¼h zu Frühmann; kommt um ½12h, findet Lie-Liechen gut.
9h zum Wohnungsamt; muß erst den Namen nennen, der vergessen wurde!
Von Riedl u. Beutel 3 Hemden á 800 Kronen.
Von Cotta (Br.): = OJ 9/31, [46] = CA 189–190, February 5, 1921. Freigabe!
An Hertzka (K.): Direktiven erbeten.

tei:div.tei:opener: February 7, 1921 Better weather, in the evening snowfall.

tei:ab.tei:seg: From Berlin (registered) photographs of the Andante.
From Julian (letter): the story of his being given the position.
8:15 to Frühmann; coming at 11:30, finds Lie-Liechen better.
9:00 to the housing office; must first give my name, which they have forgotten!
From Riedl and Beutel three shirts at 800 Kronen.
From Cotta (letter): released from contract!
To Hertzka (postcard): requesting directives.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Caféhaus.
Dr. Fischmann findet Deutsch’ Vertrag in Ordnung.
5h Herr Brand, Schüler von Schreker: tadle Fugen u. andere Stücke, spreche überhaupt Kompositionstalent ab, rate Klavierspiel zu lernen, empfehle Frl. Kahn.
Brünauer von der Reise nach Deutschland zurück; ladet für „nach Weihnachten“ ein; erbitte 10 kg Zucker.
Von U. E.: Vorwort Mondschein-Sonate usw.
Lie-Liechen macht Brotteig.
Coffee-house.
Dr. Fischmann finds that the Deutsch' contract is all right.

5:00 Mr. Brand, pupil of Schreker: I censure him for his fugues and other pieces, denying that he has any talent for composition, and advise him to learn to play the piano, recommending Miss Kahn to him.
Brünauer is back from his trip to Germany; invites for "after Christmas"; I request 10 kilos of sugar.
From UE: Preface to the "Moonlight" Sonata etc.
Lie-Liechen makes bread dough.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von der preuss. Staatsbibliothek (Br.): Rechnung, 10% Ermäßigung.
Im Archiv Thayer Alexander W. Thayer, Ludwig van Beethoven's Leben, ed. and transl. H. Deiters, vol. III (Berlin, 1879 or later edition). entlehnt.
Lie-Liechen bringt von der U. E. op. 101, 1. u. 2. Satz umbrochen.
Nach Tisch zu Deutsch mit unterzeichnetem Vertrag, Korrektur übergeben, Claudius gekauft 156 Kronen.
Miva-Klingen: 150 Kronen.
Galoschen "Galosche": rubber overshoe. für Lie-Liechen 580 Kronen.
Zwirn gekauft.
Klammerth erzählt von Figdors Haltung im Seminar, die unverständlich ist.
Heini B bringt das Brot u. Heringsalat.
From the Prussian State Library (letter): invoice, 10% discount.
In the Archive borrowing Thayer.
Lie-Liechen brings Op. 101, first and second movements from the UE in page make-up.
After the meal to Deutsch's with the contract already signed, handed over corrected proof, purchased Claudius for 156 Kronen.
Miva-razor blades: 150 Kronen.
Galoshes for Lie-Liechen 580 Kronen.
Purchased yarn.
Klammerth tells us about Figdor's approach in his seminar, which is incomprehensible.
Heini brings the bread and herring salad.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Einschenk (eing.): meldet den Tod der Tante.
Von Sophie (K.): erkundigt sich nach dem Befinden u. bittet um Antwort.
Nun erst Elias erhöht, nachdem die große Auslage für sie entfallen.

Caféhaus: Moszisker u. Schaab für Mittwoch bestellt, um
Freitag zur Beerdigung gehen zu können.
Von Deutsch Manuscript zurück u. ein Buch zur Ansicht.
From Einschenk (registered): announces the death of my aunt.
From Sophie (postcard): asks about our state of health and requesting a reply.
Increased Elias's fee, now that her large expenditure is out of the way.

Coffee-house: have arranged with Moszisker and Schaab that they should come on Wednesday, so that
we can attend the funeral on Friday.
From Deutsch returning the manuscript and sending a book for my perusal.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: 9h zum Friedhof; Onkel erzählt die Geschichte der zweijährigen Krankheit; übergebe 2000 Kronen.
Ins Wohnungsamt: vergebens.
Von Frau Wally (K.): sagt für Sonntag ab.
At 9:00 to the cemetery; Onkel gives an account of her illness which had lasted two years; hand over 2000 Kronen.
To the housing office: to no avail.
From Wally (postcard): cancels the appointment on Sunday.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen zur U. E. mit Korrekturen, bringt den Vertrag betreffend die Theorien heim.
Loibl trägt Kohle zu mir u. Lie-Liechen: 100 Kronen.
Der alte Bednař trifft uns nicht im Gasthaus; nach Tisch zu ihm; empfiehlt zu Kletschka zu gehen; alle Wege dennoch vergeblich.
Frl. Elias zahlt 12000 Kronen.
An Sophie u. Julian Briefe.
An Vrieslander (K.): über den Verlagswechsel; kündige Hupka an.
Lie-Liechen to the UE with corrected proofs, brings the contract regarding my Theories home.
Loibl brings coal to my apartment and to Lie-Liechen's: 100 Kronen.
Old Mr. Bednař does not meet up with us in the restaurant; after the meal to his place; recommends that we go to Kletschka; but all these excursions lead to nothing.
Miss Elias pays 12,000 Kronen.
To Sophie and Julian letters.
To Vrieslander (postcard): about the change of publishers; I announce that Hupka is coming.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen badet die Pflanzen.
Der Major schwer leidend.
Ueber Medek, Toni Baudrexel Either Mr. Baudrexel or Baudrexel, Jr. zu Dr. Vogler wegen Wohnung; Mißverständnis, überflüssige Lauferei.
Lie-Liechen waters the plants.
The Major is suffering greatly.
On the recommendation of Medek, Toni Baudrexel to Dr. Vogler in the matter of the apartment; a misunderstanding, all this running around is superfluous.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen zu Medek: Bericht.
Zu Dr. Schulz u. Zechmeister wegen Richardgasse I.
Brotteig.
Pairamall meldet von Kletschka: Keilgasse 8; sie bietet sich an, die Senatsmitglieder durch ihn zu erforschen.
Lie-Liechen to Medek: a report.
To Dr. Schulz and Zechmeister regarding Richardgasse I.
Bread dough.
Pairamall reports to us from Kletschka: Keilgasse 8; she would be prepared to get him to approach the members of the Senate about the apartment.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Wollzeile 12: über Inserat; Fopperei eines Wohnungsbureaus.
Von Cotta über Zollamt Manuscript Schenker's manuscript for all or part of Kontrapunkt 2. zurück.
Nach Tisch vom Zollamt abgeholt, dann zu U. E. u. Dr. Kalmus übergeben.
Hupka drahtet: "drahten": to send a telegram. Erfolg in Berlin über Erwarten.
Brünauer bringt 1 kg Zucker.
Wollzeile 12: via an advertisement in the newspaper; a joke perpetrated by an apartment agency.
From Cotta returning the manuscript via the customs office.
After lunch collect it from the customs office, then to the UE and hand it over to Dr. Kalmus.
Hupka wires a telegram: success in Berlin beyond all expectations.
Brünauer brings 1 kilo of sugar.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg:
¼9h im Wohnungsamt; Gesuch wegen Richardgasse überreicht; Herr Fiedler raunte zu: Etwas ist im Zuge, möchte aber nicht aus der
Schule schwatzen; empfiehlt Wege zu Kohl u. Kolbe.
Stunden gegeben statt Freitag.
Lie-Liechen viel unterwegs.
Steuer freiwillig um 50 Kronen monatlich erhöht.
Nach Tisch Keilgasse 8; überbringen Resultat zu Kletschka; empfiehlt, Freitag zum Kommissär zu gehen u. sich auf den Akt zu berufen.
Von U. E. = OC 52/248, February 14, 1921. Korrekturen.

At 8:15 in the housing office; handing in an application for the apartment in the Richardgasse; Mr. Fiedler is muttering: something is in the air, does not wish to to tell tales out of school;
recommends a visit to Kohl and Kolbe.
Gave lessons today instead of on Friday.
Lie-Liechen is out and about much.
Have voluntarily increased tax payments by 50 Kronen per month.
After lunch to the Keilgasse 8; conveying the results to Kletschka; recommends, that on Friday we should go to the commissioner and make a direct reference to the file.
From the UE proofs.
At Brünauer's with Dr. Robitschek; who has us driven home; Lie-Liechen receives three cactuses from his wife.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Frimmels Kritik in der Wiener Zeitung über die Sonaten Theodor Frimmel, "Schriften über Beethoven aus der Zeit des Weltkrieges," Wiener Zeitung, February 13, 1921, a clipping of which is preserved in Schenker's scrapbook at OC 2/p. 59. It mentions publication of the Erläuterungsausgabe of Op. 109 and Op. 110. durch den Observer.
Um 4h Frau Pairamall bei Lie-Liechen: teilt nach Kletschka mit, Kohl sei bestechlich.
100 kg Kohle 580 Kr. u. Tabak.
Frimmel's review in the Wiener Zeitung of the Sonatas by the Observer.
At 4:00 Mrs. Pairamall with Lie-Liechen: she says, according to Kletschka, Kohl will take a bribe.
100 kg coal 580 Kronen and tobacco.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Aus Berlin (eing.): Bilder zum Scherzo The Scherzo of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony, for the conclusion of Schenker's article on this work in Tonwille Heft 5 (1923). u. Rechnung.
Nachmittag Bad: 60 + 20 Kronen.
Ins Wohnungsamt. Kletschkas Auftrag ausgerichtet: Gesuch machen!
Im Archiv: Thayer Alexander W. Thayer, Ludwig van Beethoven's Leben, ed. and transl. H. Deiters, vol. III (Berlin, 1879 or later edition). zurück.
From Berlin (registered): photographs of the Scherzo and an invoice.
In the afternoon at the public baths: 60 + 20 Kronen.
To the housing office. Bring them Kletschka's instructions: application should be handed in!
At the Archive: return the Thayer.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Roth (Br.): Verteidigung u. Selbsterläuterung gegen meine Einwürfe.
Frl. Elias Vertrag gezeigt.

Von U. E: 4 Bände Thayer: In his library at his death, Schenker had Alexander W. Thayer, Ludwig van Beethovens Leben, ed. and transl. H. Deiters, 2nd edn, rev. H. Riemann, 5 vols (Berlin: Brietkopf & Härtel, 1901–08). über 2500 Kr.
Letzte Korrektur zur Mondschein-Sonate übergeben.
From Roth (letter): self-defense and explanations regarding my objections.
Showed Miss Elias the contract.
From UE: four volumes of Thayer: over 2,500 Kronen.
Hand in the final proof corrections to the "Moonlight" Sonata.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Mittelmann (K.): Dank für Ermäßigung.
An Hertzka (Br.): Korrekturen zurück, erbitte detailierte Rechnung über Thayer u. Austragung der Niloff-Angelegenheit.
An Cotta (Br.): = CA 193, February 20, 1921. Dank; erkundige mich nach der Schlußabrechnung.
An die Expedition "Expedition": Archaic for "Anzeigenabteilung", advertisement department. des N. W. Tgbl. u. der N. Fr. Pr. wegen Wohnung.
Gesuch zu Keilgasse 8 verfertigt.
Jetty Rechnung beglichen: 618 Kronen für Spiritus u. Butter.
To Mittelmann (postcard): thank him for the discount.
To Hertzka (letter): returning the corrected proofs, request a detailed invoice for the Thayer and deal with the matter of Niloff.
To Cotta (letter): Thanks; make my inquiries about the final calculation.
To the expedition of the Neues Wiener Tagblatt and the Neue Freie Presse in the matter of the apartment.
Application regarding the Keilgasse 8 completed.
Settled the Jetty invoice: 618 Kronen for spirits and butter.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Hupka (K. aus Leipzig): = OJ 14/1, [H1], February 18, [1921] (incorrectly filed among the letters of Felix Salzer to Schenker). Kritik vernichtend, nur Straube einverstanden „entzückt“; erkundigt sich, ob ich nach Leipzig kommen wollte.

Von Frau Jahn (Br.): Einladung zum
Trioabend.
Lie-Liechen zum Kommissär: Zechmeister sieht nach Keilgasse 9 nach.
Zu U-E: übergibt Korrekturen.
Nach 12h zur Bank: werden erst nach einer Woche den Pfandschein zurückgeben, den Frl. Elias zu Zwecke der Vermögensabgabe mitverwenden will.
Besichtigung Keilgasse 9: Wohnung für uns unbrauchbar.
Frau Pairamall nennt den Vertreter von Stadler, wo wir uns Rat holen sollen.
Bamberger bittet um eine 3. Stunde.
Bei Lie-Liechen Zeitung in Ordnung gebracht; bei mir bis spät nachts nur einen Teil.
From Hupka (postcard from Leipzig): The criticism is annihilating, only Straube is in favor "delighted"; inquires as to whether or not I wish to come to Leipzig.

From Mrs. Jahn (letter): invitation to a
trio evening.
Lie-Liechen goes to the commissioner: Zechmeister is going to look at the Keilgasse 9 apartment.
To U-E: hand in the corrected proofs.
After 12 noon to the bank: in a week's time we will return the certificate of obligation, which Miss Elias wishes to use too for the purposes of paying taxes on her savings.
Go to a showing of the Keilgasse 9: the apartment is useless for our pusposes.
Mrs. Pairamall gives us the names of Stadler's representative, where we should receive some advice.
Bamberger requests a third lesson.
At Lie-Liechen's I get the newspapers into shape; at my apartment working late into the night I only manage to sort out part of the newspapers.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921

sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Nach Tisch zur Kommission in die Schmidtgasse: erklären uns mit Keilgasse 9 nicht einverstanden.
Weisse zu Tisch wegen Wohnung.
Anforderung einer Gas-Vorauszahlung.
After lunch to the Commission in the Schmidtgasse: to explain that we are not in agreement with the Keilgasse 9.
Weisse joins us at lunch regarding the apartment.
Request to make a pre-payment on the gas bill.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Kohn (Br.): Erhöhung auf 300 Kronen.
Beim Kommissär: der Weg zu Kohl sei überflüssig, eher zum Staats-Sekretär; „es wird schon werden“.
An Siemens (K.): Beitrittserklärung zum Sprachverein.
Nach Tisch zu Emil Gärtner, Erkundigung nach dem Namen des Staatssekretärs.
Lie-Liechen setzt die Kakteen um.
From Kohn (letter): Increase to 300 Kronen.
At the Commissioner's: a visit to Kohl is superfluous, much rather we should be going to State Secretary; "it will work out in the end."
To Siemens (postcard): declaring that I am taking up membership of the German Language Society.
After lunch to Emil Gärtner's, asking for the name of the State Secretary.
Lie-Liechen re-pots the cactuses.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Cotta (Br.): = OJ 9/31, [47] = CA 197, February 21, 1921. Angabe von Vorräten, beiliegend auch für U. E.; = OJ 9/31, [48] = CA 194–195, February 21, 1921. Abrechnung werde wie üblich im Herbst erfolgen.
Von Emil Gärtner: Breisky.
Von Sophie (K.): erwartet ein Schreiben.
Beim Kommissär meine Verträge vorgewiesen; sucht nach dem Akt Engländer.
Zu Tisch schickt Jetty durch Frau Augustin 81 dkg Butter.
Caféhaus.
Zu Waldheim u. Eberle, wo wir mit größtem Interesse zwei Stunden lang, von Beamten geführt, die dDruckerei besichtigen; auch Herr Volk, den ich von früher kenne, macht seine Aufwartung.

Brünauer bringt 2 kg Zucker, läßt sich 10 kg
bezahlen.
Lose gekauft.
From Cotta (letter): lists what they have in stock, an attachment for the UE too; the settling of the account will take place in the Fall as usual.
From Emil Gärtner: Breisky.
From Sophie (postcard): expects a letter.
At the Commissioner I present my contracts; he searches for the file on Engländer.
At lunchtime Jetty sends 81 decagrams of butter via Mrs. Augustin 81 dkg Butter.
Coffee-house.
To Waldheim & Eberle, where for two hours and with great interest we are shown the printing factory by two officials; also Mr. Volk, whom I knew from before, paid us the courtesy of a visit.
Brünauer brings 2 kilos of sugar, takes payment for 10 kilos.
Lottery tickets purchased.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von U. E. (Br.): = OC 52/249-250, February 23, 1921, with contract incorporated within letter. Vertrag; bittet um Titel-Aenderung der „kleinen Bibliothek“; detailierte Rechnung Thayer. In his library at his death, Schenker had Alexander W. Thayer, Ludwig van Beethovens Leben, ed. and transl. H. Deiters, 2nd edn, rev. H. Riemann, 5 vols (Berlin: Brietkopf & Härtel, 1901–08).
An Frau Wally (K.): erbitte die Adresse des Frl. Reich, um in Erfahrung zu bringen, ob das Honorar schon erlegt ist.

Von U. E.: Korrektur zu op. 111 u. zur V., "Beethoven: V. Sinfonie," in: Tonwille, Heft 1 (1921), 27–37; Eng. transl., I, pp. 25–33. auch Bach. "Joh. Seb. Bach: Wohtemperiertes Klavier, Band I. Präludium Es-Moll," in: Tonwille, Heft 1 (1921), 38–45; Eng. transl., I, pp. 34–40.
Abends zum erstenmal Schinken.
Brotteig.
From the UE (letter): contract; requesting a change to the title of the Little Library; a detailed invoice for the Thayer.
To Wally (postcard): requesting the address of Miss Reich, so that we can find out whether or not the fee has been dealt with.
From the UE: proofs of Op. 111 and to V., also Bach.
In the evening for the first time ham.
Bread dough.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen mit Teig zu Jetty.
Frau Baudrexel bittet, um 9½h fortzugehen!
Frau Loibl läßt sich vertreten; die Vertreterin wird in 10 Min. fertig: „schnell is’ g’angen“; „u. kehren?“ frage ich; darauf der Sohn: „Mir scheint die Mutter hat vorgestern ‚kehrt“!
Ordnung in der „Kl. Bibl.“.
Suche den Gärtner im botanischen Garten auf; verspricht Dienstag zu kommen.
Zu Jetty, Brot mitgenommen.
An Hertzka (Br.): Vorschlag zum Titel u. Imprimatur.
Lie-Liechen goes to Jetty with the dough
Mrs. Baudrexel requests that she may leave at 9:30!

Mrs. Loibl has someone deputize for her; her substitute finishes in ten minutes: "That didn't take long"; "and what about the sweeping?" I ask; to which Loibl's son replies: "It looks to me as if my mother swept the day before yesterday"!
Have put the Little Library into good order.
I go and look for the gardener in the botanical gardens; he promises that he will come on Tuesday.
To Jetty's, taking bread.
To Hertzka (letter): suggestions about the title and the imprimatur.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD

sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Dr. Amarant (K.): wegen Wohnungstausches.
Nach 12h zur Bank: Pfandschein kommt erst Mittwoch.
Gas-Vorauszahlung 300 Kr.
Nach Tisch zum Tischler: noch nicht fertig.
From Dr. Amarant (postcard): regarding the exchange of apartments.
After 12 noon to the bank: certificate of obligation is coming on Wednesday.
The pre-payment for the gas is 300 Kronen.
After lunch to the carpenter's: still not finished.
